title: Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=9e76987ac684f8ad err=timeout
body:
#### System information
Geth version: `1.8.15-stable-89451f7c`
OS & Version: Linux  Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS


In log, there are a lot of "Synchronisation failed, dropping peer" message . My eth node syncs data very slowly, is hard to catch up with main net blocks. How to fix this ?



Some of log :


INFO [09-03|01:52:17.103] Imported new chain segment               blocks=17 txs=958  mgas=112.742 elapsed=9.081s    mgasps=12.414  number=6259586 hash=47029b…2e2e6e cache=536.36mB
INFO [09-03|01:52:24.096] Imported new chain segment               blocks=21 txs=1740 mgas=147.494 elapsed=6.993s    mgasps=21.091  number=6259607 hash=05881a…d15a4d cache=535.78mB
INFO [09-03|01:52:32.555] Imported new chain segment               blocks=10 txs=1020 mgas=66.433  elapsed=8.457s    mgasps=7.855   number=6259617 hash=c62d1f…6c7e49 cache=536.25mB
INFO [09-03|01:52:40.964] Imported new chain segment               blocks=28 txs=1927 mgas=155.006 elapsed=8.408s    mgasps=18.435  number=6259645 hash=c6b928…4f8ec8 cache=534.73mB
INFO [09-03|01:52:43.517] Imported new chain segment               blocks=9  txs=542  mgas=45.037  elapsed=2.553s    mgasps=17.640  number=6259654 hash=650977…6692c3 cache=533.38mB
INFO [09-03|01:52:51.685] Imported new chain segment               blocks=16 txs=1165 mgas=101.154 elapsed=8.166s    mgasps=12.387  number=6259670 hash=1dc746…fb288c cache=534.52mB
INFO [09-03|01:52:57.656] Imported new chain segment               blocks=25 txs=2234 mgas=142.704 elapsed=5.970s    mgasps=23.900  number=6259695 hash=26d9ed…d775b5 cache=535.82mB
INFO [09-03|01:53:03.357] Imported new chain segment               blocks=13 txs=1222 mgas=93.600  elapsed=5.700s    mgasps=16.421  number=6259708 hash=238f6a…bfef04 cache=536.07mB
WARN [09-03|01:53:13.472] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=73f80f432715009c err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:54:25.355] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=41aa5896891b7af3 err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:54:33.487] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=93891ff70e28ffeb err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:54:43.086] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=2f48d8fadd6e958a err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:54:50.083] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=2523968115d15c9e err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:54:58.656] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=14a17a4feaf53248 err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:55:42.601] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=713197792909aaca err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:55:50.583] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=6a9fcd24294d4780 err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:57:38.542] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=2baac1ac869b5398 err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:57:45.278] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=f5a455ec2c5f7bf7 err=timeout
WARN [09-03|01:59:37.264] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=c0c24f9efecbf08b err=timeout
WARN [09-03|02:00:09.466] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=0e798a7bc5d81184 err=timeout
WARN [09-03|02:00:35.940] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=1b08e1d13cf1d3b0 err=timeout

I'm also experiencing synchronization issues with the Geth Ropsten. When I start `geth`, geth hangs at `HTTP endpoint opened`.  Also `eth.syncing` in the console returns `false`.

Here is the command I enter in the cli
```
geth console --testnet --syncmode "fast" --rpc --rpcapi eth,net,web3 --bootnodes "enode://20c9ad97c081d63397d7b685a412227a40e23c8bdc6688c6f37e97cfbc22d2b4d1db1510d8f61e6a8866ad7f0e17c02b14182d37ea7c3c8b9c2683aeb6b733a1@52.169.14.227:30303,enode://6ce05930c72abc632c58e2e4324f7c7ea478cec0ed4fa2528982cf34483094e9cbc9216e7aa349691242576d552a2a56aaeae426c5303ded677ce455ba1acd9d@13.84.180.240:30303"
```

### System
Geth version: 1.8.14
OS version: Mac High Sierra 10.13.6
timeout was happening for me on private network when all the cpu cores geth filled up
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
